item.title: Why I Love Elixir (Erlang)
Violating the Law of Demeter
item.description: A co-worker linked to the following article describing some of JavaScript’s new features in 2020 this past week: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/javascript-new-features-es2020/. One of the features that stood out was optional chaining. This brings with it something that I’ve already seen in other languages that I work with, namely Ruby, and its #try or &. (safe navigation operator). This sort of convenience feature is a double-edged sword: good for scripting not so good for any software that is to be extended and or maintained 1.
